body:
In our integration test, we have a test to exec into a container and `echo` a very long string.
It started failing since I updated containerd to HEAD.
```console
$ cluster/kubectl.sh --server=https://localhost:6443 --kubeconfig=/var/run/kubernetes/admin.kubeconfig exec nginx echo 
error: Internal error occurred: error executing command in container: failed to exec in container: failed to create exec "d64200186915091de9be3b32a1df9b010656de461d8a6ccf5bba2e9cab9fecf1": read unix @->@/containerd-shim/k8s.io/43b34bf65eb159bdc8225b28a901f4419ea0a38288284021baa4225514a03203/shim.sock: read: connection reset by peer: unknown
```

I guess this is related to the new ttrpc change.
Do we have any buffer limit or something inside the shim? @stevvooe
title: Can't exec a long command.
